======================================
Asymptotic Performance Benchmark
======================================

Testing various grid sizes on full GPU (14 SMs)...
Looking for point where ns/cell becomes constant

Testing Grid: 64x64 (4096 cells)
  Time: 0.2243076115846634s, ns/cell: 54.7626, Checksum: 95.29683677712327

Testing Grid: 96x96 (9216 cells)
  Time: 0.23163357377052307s, ns/cell: 25.1338, Checksum: 143.53018067820355

Testing Grid: 128x128 (16384 cells)
  Time: 0.2296310719102621s, ns/cell: 14.0155, Checksum: 257.311488287519

Testing Grid: 192x192 (36864 cells)
  Time: 0.23838655464351177s, ns/cell: 6.4666, Checksum: 578.4146248799386

Testing Grid: 256x256 (65536 cells)
  Time: 0.23336218670010567s, ns/cell: 3.5608, Checksum: 1038.9418329586078

Testing Grid: 384x384 (147456 cells)
  Time: 0.2347493264824152s, ns/cell: 1.5919, Checksum: 2354.6150274281117

Testing Grid: 512x512 (262144 cells)
  Time: 0.23139607720077038s, ns/cell: .8827, Checksum: 4117.908384293905

Testing Grid: 768x768 (589824 cells)
  Time: 0.23438082076609135s, ns/cell: .3973, Checksum: 9264.933737573405

Testing Grid: 1024x1024 (1048576 cells)
  Time: 0.4004953596740961s, ns/cell: .3819, Checksum: 16470.993291673225

Testing Grid: 1536x1536 (2359296 cells)
  Time: 0.8311595860868692s, ns/cell: .3522, Checksum: 37059.734906218946

Testing Grid: 2048x2048 (4194304 cells)
  Time: 1.433808820322156s, ns/cell: .3418, Checksum: 65883.97316661144

Asymptotic performance results saved to: asymptotic_performance_results.txt
======================================

Look for the grid size where ns/cell stabilizes (becomes constant)
This indicates the minimum workload for efficient GPU utilization
